intro: Euploca myriophylla, commonly known as the flame grass, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its striking, bright red or orange inflorescences that resemble flames, hence its common name. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family, which includes other aromatic plants like eucalyptus. Euploca myriophylla is often found in open habitats and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
